newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Dec 10.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Dec 10.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Two special committees, one for market monitoring and the other for reconsidering the circuit-breaker will be formed soon to restore confidence in the share market.
Investment Corporation of Bangladesh (ICB) has resumed disbursement of loan on 1:1 ratio as investment for purchasing shares from the secondary market.
Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has introduced a quota of five percent in Initial Public Offering (IPO) for non-resident Bangladeshis (NRBs) out of IPO available for local investors.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has urged the engineers to face the challenges of market economy by enhancing skill and by boosting production. She asked them to complete all projects in time.
BNP Chairperson and leader of opposition in parliament, Begum Khaleda Zia, said the people, particularly the opposition activists, are becoming victims of human rights violation.

Road communications between the capital and the 36 northern and southern districts of the country have remained almost snapped for the fourth consecutive day following heavy traffic jam at Aricha and Nagarbari ghats.
Government employees have threatened a greater action programme for realising their five-point demand, mainly pay hike and dearness allowances for interim period.

Production in the country's largest state-owned fertilizer factory, Chittagong Urea Fertilizer Limited (CUFL), may be suspended from midnight tonight due to disconnection of gas supply by the Bakhrabad Gas System Limited, according to CUFL sources.
